title: Complex Vowels
objectives: Practice reading syllables with complex vowels
context: Korean has 10 basic vowels and 11 complex vowels. Complex vowels are made by combining two basic vowels together!
For example: ㅏ + ㅣ = ㅐ (like 'ae' in 'cat'). These compound vowels follow logical patterns.
Learning these will help you read and pronounce Korean words more accurately.
explanation: ㅐ (ae) and ㅔ (e) sound almost identical in modern Korean - like 'eh' in 'bed'. Many Koreans pronounce them the same!
ㅚ is supposed to sound like 'we' but most Koreans pronounce it like ㅞ or just 'we/oe'.
ㅟ sounds like 'wee' in 'sweet'. It's ㅜ + ㅣ combined.
ㅢ is tricky! It sounds like 'ui' (oo-ee blended) but only at the start of words. Otherwise it often sounds like 'i'.
ㅑ (ya) is like 'ya' in 'yard'. It's the 'y' version of ㅏ.
ㅕ (yeo) is like 'yo' in 'yogurt'. It's the 'y' version of ㅓ.
Pattern: Adding a short line (ㅣ) to basic vowels makes them 'y' sounds: ㅏ→ㅑ, ㅓ→ㅕ, ㅗ→ㅛ, ㅜ→ㅠ
